alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 4:04PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Several strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Rio Blanco and southeastern Uintah Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 400 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking several strong thunderstorms 17 t 27 miles southwest of Dinosaur, or from 45 miles southwest to 34 miles southeast of Vernal, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dinosaur. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 169 and 173. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
